42 Orang Tewas dalam Aksi-aksi Demo Antipemerintah di Haiti
02 Nov 2019, 15:31 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Port-au-Prince - Aksi-aksi demonstrasi antipemerintah telah terjadi di Haiti sejak pertengahan September lalu. Setidaknya 42 orang dilaporkan telah tewas dan puluhan lainnya luka-luka dalam aksi demo besar-besaran tersebut.
Angka tersebut disampaikan badan HAM PBB yang menyatakan sangat prihatin akan krisis di Haiti tersebut.
"Kami sangat prihatin dengan krisis yang berkepanjangan di Haiti, dan dampaknya pada kemampuan warga Haiti untuk mengakses hak-hak dasar mereka untuk perawatan kesehatan, makanan, pendidikan dan kebutuhan lainnya," demikian disampaikan Kantor Komisioner Tinggi HAM PBB (OHCHR) dalam sebuah statemen seperti dilansir kantor berita AFP, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Badan HAM PBB tersebut menyatakan bahwa berdasarkan laporan-laporan, pasukan keamanan Haiti bertanggung jawab atas 19 kematian demonstran. Para demonstran lainnya tewas karena orang-orang bersenjata atau para penyerang tak dikenal.
Negara termiskin di Amerika itu tengah dilanda aksi-aksi demo selama dua bulan ini. Aksi-aksi protes besar-besaran itu awalnya dipicu oleh kenaikan harga dan kelangkaan bahan bakar, namun kemudian meluas menjadi kampanye untuk menggulingkan Presiden Jovenel Moise.

42 people killed in anti-government demonstrations in Haiti
02 Nov 2019, 15:31 by Rita Uli Hutapea
Port-au-Prince - Antigovernment demonstrations have taken place in Haiti since mid-September. At least 42 people have been reported killed and dozens injured in the massive demonstration.
The figure was conveyed by the UN human rights agency which stated very concerned about the crisis in Haiti.
"We are very concerned about the ongoing crisis in Haiti, and its impact on the ability of Haitians to access their basic rights to health care, food, education and other needs," the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said in a statement such as reported by the AFP news agency on Saturday (11/02/2019).
The UN human rights agency stated that based on reports, Haitian security forces were responsible for 19 deaths of protesters. The other demonstrators were killed by gunmen or unknown attackers.
The poorest country in America has been hit by demonstrations over the past two months. The massive protests were initially triggered by rising prices and fuel shortages, but later expanded into a campaign to overthrow President Jovenel Moise.
